meaningMnemonic: The <radical>few</radical> members of society without <radical>power</radical> suffer from severe <kanji>inferiority</kanji> complexes. Most people in this world have lots of power, so the few that do not feel quite inferior. It is this feeling of inferiority that fuels their inferiority complexes.
readingMnemonic: Since you suffer from such extreme feelings of <kanji>inferiority</kanji>, when someone offers you and your friends the chance to gain power, you yell “<reading>Let’s</reading> (れつ) go!” without a second thought. “Let’s go, guys! Come on! Power awaits us!”
